018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import java.util.Comparator;
021import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
022
023import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.OPTIONAL;
024import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.MANDATORY;
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
026
027
028/**
029 * Defines the sort order of a property.
030 *
031 * @author  Jody Garnett (Refractions Research)
032 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
033 * @version 3.1
034 *
035 * @param  <R>  the type of resources (e.g. {@link org.opengis.feature.Feature}) to sort.
036 *
037 * @see SortBy#getSortProperties()
038 *
039 * @since 3.1
040 */
041@UML(identifier="SortProperty", specification=ISO_19143)
042public interface SortProperty<R> extends Comparator<R> {
043    /**
044     * The property to sort by.
045     *
046     * @return the property to sort by.
047     */
048    @UML(identifier="valueReference", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
049    ValueReference<R,?> getValueReference();
050
051    /**
052     * The sorting order, ascending or descending.
053     * The default value is ascending order.
054     *
055     * @return the sorting order.
056     */
057    @UML(identifier="sortOrder", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
058    default SortOrder getSortOrder() {
059        return SortOrder.ASCENDING;
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * Compares two resources for order. Returns a negative number if {@code r1} should be sorted before {@code r2},
064     * a positive number if {@code r2} should be after {@code r1}, or 0 if both resources are equal.
065     * The ordering of null resources or null property values is unspecified.
066     *
067     * <p>The comparison shall be consistent (ignoring unspecified aspects such as null values) with a comparison
068     * done "manually" by fetching the values identified by the {@linkplain #getValueReference() value reference}
069     * from the two resources and comparing them according the {@linkplain #getSortOrder() sort order}.
070     * In order words, it shall be possible for the users to build their own SQL (or other language) query
071     * using above information and get the same results without invoking this {@code compare(…)} method.</p>
072     *
073     * @param  r1  the first resource to compare.
074     * @param  r2  the second resource to compare.
075     * @return negative if the first resource is before the second, positive for the converse, or 0 if equal.
076     * @throws InvalidFilterValueException if the expression cannot be applied on the given resources.
077     * @throws ClassCastException if the types of {@linkplain ValueReference#apply(Object) property values}
078     *         prevent them from being compared by this comparator.
079     *
080     * @see SortBy#compare(Object, Object)
081     */
082    @Override
083    int compare(R r1, R r2);
084}
